Class TrustMeta

java.lang.Object
com.kicas.rp.data.flagdata.FlagMeta
com.kicas.rp.data.flagdata.TrustMeta
All Implemented Interfaces:
Augmentable<TrustMeta>
public class TrustMeta extends FlagMeta implements Augmentable<TrustMeta>
The metadata class for the trust region flag.

    • augment

      public void augment(TrustMeta other)
      Sets this meta's public trust level to that of the given meta and adds all explicit trusts in the given meta to this meta's internal list.
      Specified by:
      augment in interface Augmentable<TrustMeta>
      Parameters:
      other - the other trust meta.

    • reduce

      public void reduce(TrustMeta other)
      If this meta's public trust level is equal to that of the given meta, then the public trust level in this meta is set to none. All explicit trusts in this meta that match trusts in the given meta are removed.
      Specified by:
      reduce in interface Augmentable<TrustMeta>
      Parameters:
      other - the other object.

    • hasTrust

      public boolean hasTrust(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, TrustLevel trust, FlagContainer container)
      Returns whether or not the given player has the specified level of trust for the given flag container. If the player's trust level is explicitly defined in this object, then that value is used otherwise it defaults to the public trust level. If the specified player is the owner of the container, then true is always returned. If the specified container of this trust meta is a Region with a parent, then unless explicitly defined in this meta this method will default to the trust meta of the parent of the given container.
      Parameters:
      player - the player.
      trust - the trust level.
      container - the flag container.
      Returns:
      true if the given player has the given level of trust, false other wise.

    • trust

      public void trust(UUID uuid, TrustLevel trust)
      Explicitly defines the given player's trust level.
      Parameters:
      uuid - the player's UUID.
      trust - the trust level.

    • getTrustList

      public Map<TrustLevel,List<UUID>> getTrustList()
      Returns:
      a mapping of every trust level to a list of the UUIDs with that trust level.

    • getFormattedTrustList

      public Map<TrustLevel,String> getFormattedTrustList()
      Returns:
      a mapping of every trust level to a string containing a comma separated list of the players with that trust level.

    • getTrustLevelByName

      public TrustLevel getTrustLevelByName(String name)
      Get the player's trustlevel from username.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.
      Returns:
      The TrustLevel of the specified player, or null if not found.

    • getAllTrustedPlayers

      public List<UUID> getAllTrustedPlayers()
      Gives a list of all trusted player UUIDs
      Returns:
      A list of the uuids for players with any trust on a region

    • getAllTrustedPlayerNames

      public List<String> getAllTrustedPlayerNames()
      Gives a list of the names of all trusted player names
      Returns:
      A list of the names for players with any trust on a region

    • toMetaString

      public String toMetaString()
      Returns this trust meta in string form. If the trust data is empty and the public trust level is set to NONE, then "[No Trust]" is returned. If the trust data is empty and the public trust level is set to BUILD, then "[Full Trust]" is returned.
      Specified by:
      toMetaString in class FlagMeta
      Returns:
      this trust meta in string form.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Returns true if an only if the given object is a trust meta instance, and if the trust lists are equal and the public trust levels are equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - the object to test.
      Returns:
      true if this trust meta is equivalent to the given object, false otherwise.

    • readMetaString

      public void readMetaString(String metaString)
      Updates this trust meta based on the given string. The format for a trust meta is as follows: for an individual trust level, the name of the trust level should be followed by a colon, then a comma separated list of the players who are to be designated that trust level. If "public" is encountered as a player name, then that trust level will be assigned to the public. Each individual trust level as defined above should be separated by a space character. If the given string is empty then an empty trust meta will be returned.
      Specified by:
      readMetaString in class FlagMeta
      Parameters:
      metaString - the string to parse.
